snippet: The trial of Samuel Mullet Sr. and some of his followers accused in connection with beard-cutting attacks spotlights the ways of an obscure religious group.
abstract: Cleveland hate-crimes trial of Samuel Mullet Sr and members of his eastern Ohio Amish splinter sect, in which they are accused in connection with beard-cutting bias attacks, spotlights the folkways of an obscure religious group; jury members and spectators receive a crash course in Amish culture from testimony during the first week of the trial.
lead_paragraph: The trial of Samuel Mullet Sr. and some of his followers accused in connection with beard-cutting attacks spotlights the ways of an obscure religious group.

headline.seo: In Amish Hate-Crime Trial, a Look at Reclusive Sect
headline.main: Hate-Crime Trial Offers a Crash Course in Amish Folkways
